results.title: The Fastest animal on earth
results.creator_credit: George Lindsay, FilmFair Communications and George Linsay Film Productions
results.brief_description: Gives basic facts about the cheetah, including its habits, unique physical characteristics and historicl significance. Shows cheetahs in their natural environment where their greatest enemy is man. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Genetic chance
results.creator_credit: Robert Reid and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Children My Children”.
Examines the moral and social implications of determining genetic disorders in unborn infants, and looks at the effects of a number of such disorders. Most of the discussion is centred around haemophilia.

results.title: The Formula factor
results.creator_credit: Rosalind Farber and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Documents the problems and dangers of infant formula marketing and bottle-feeding in the third world. Highlights the efforts of government health workers and church organisations to challenge the practices of multinational corporations who are irresponsible and somewhat aggressive in their promotion of formula and their chase for profits. Focuses on Nestles, the world’s largest producer of baby formula. Presented by Roy Bonisteel. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Letters from Poland
results.creator_credit: Sophia Turkiewicz, Mark Stiles and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The story of a young Polish immigrant and her struggle to build a new life in the harsh environment of post World War II Sydney. The film raises a number of themes: the loneliness of being in a foreign land; the special isolation of a migrant woman and the dislocation of a single mother needing to support both herself and her child. Cast includes Bashia Bonkowski, Martin Vaughan, Jessica O’Donnell, Arthur Krawczynski, Tracy Ellis. Photography: Martha Ansara

results.title: Collins Street Walk
results.creator_credit: Paul Connor, Tony Evans and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Children from Fitzroy Primary School are shown on the National Trust’s Collins Street Walk. They then use the graphics facility at Swinburne Institute’s computer installation to create an animated film based on the experience. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Roller skating safety
results.brief_description: Gives step-by-step lessons in roller skating through the story of a roller-rink skater who teaches her younger brother how to move on skates. In turn, the brother teaches his sister how to move safely on skates outside the rink. Emphasises that safety and etiquette are more important than the mechanics of the sport. Outlines the selection and adjustment of equipment, use of protective pads, how to fall, stop and turn. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Shane [Edited version]
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film directed by George Stevens. Starring Alan Ladd as the mysterious stranger who assists a family of homesteaders, highlighting the mythology of the Wild West and the image of the American hero.
